members.signatureBeforeChange: void configureBar (int selection, int minimum, int maximum)
members.signatureAfterChange: void configureBar (int selection, int minimum, int maximum)
diff: +	double fraction = minimum == maximum ? 1 : (double)(selection - minimum) / (maximum - minimum);

members.signatureBeforeChange: ImageData( 	int width, int height, int depth, PaletteData palette, 	int scanlinePad, byte[] data, int maskPad, byte[] maskData, 	byte[] alphaData, int alpha, int transparentPixel, int type, 	int x, int y, int disposalMethod, int delayTime)
members.signatureAfterChange: ImageData( 	int width, int height, int depth, PaletteData palette, 	int scanlinePad, byte[] data, int maskPad, byte[] maskData, 	byte[] alphaData, int alpha, int transparentPixel, int type, 	int x, int y, int disposalMethod, int delayTime)
diff: +	 * When the image is being loaded from a PNG, we need to use the theoretical minimum
+	 * number of bytes per line to check whether there is enough data, because the actual
+	 * number of bytes per line is calculated based on the given depth, which may be larger
+	 * than the actual depth of the PNG.
